title: What is a Market Structure?
description: Learn the fundamentals of market structure in trading. Understanding Higher Highs, Higher Lows, Lower Highs, and Lower Lows is essential for technical analysis.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• What market structure is
• How to identify Higher Highs (HH) and Higher Lows (HL) in uptrends
• How to identify Lower Highs (LH) and Lower Lows (LL) in downtrends
• Why market structure is the foundation of trading
• How to use this knowledge in your trading plan

quiz.question: Which of the following defines an uptrend?
quiz.explanation: An uptrend is characterized by Higher Highs (HH) and Higher Lows (HL), showing that buyers are in control and each peak/trough is progressively higher.

quiz.question: What does 'LH' stand for in market structure?
quiz.explanation: LH stands for Lower High, which occurs when the price reaches a lower peak than the previous high. This is typically seen in downtrends or when a trend is weakening.

quiz.question: Why is understanding market structure important?
options: It helps identify the direction of the trend
It removes the need for stop losses
quiz.explanation: Understanding market structure helps traders identify the direction of the trend and make informed trading decisions. However, no analysis method eliminates risk or guarantees profits.
